chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Timothy Spencer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Steven Timothy Spencer.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is requesting Attorney Graber be removed from the case.  Court denied defendant's request to remove Attorney Graber. Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Steven Timothy Spencer.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Tonya Brice.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch *.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Attorney Graber has been appointed as counsel for the defendant.  Court set a preliminary hearing date.  This hearing will be held in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Timothy Spencer appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will adjourn hearing and finds GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared in person. No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 6-21-22 at 1:30 pm for preliminary hearing by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant contacted customer service on 04-29-2022 to inform that he has no permanent address at this time.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant provide updated address at next court hearing.

Court ordered no contact with SMH and her children.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Steven Timothy Spencer in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Timothy Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
